DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether or not the autopsy findings are available.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Death Diagnosis Domain Autopsy Finding Availability
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis._A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3854448 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
